--- title: 'World Development Indicators' author: 'Emma Carrier' date: '10/09/24' format: revealjs: theme: solarized transition: fade bibliography: references.bib --- ## Introduction This presentation investigates the relationship between several variables from the World Development Indicators list. Some of these variables include GDP per Capita, Measles Vaccination Percentages, and Inflation Rates. --- ## GDP Growth Rate The GDP growth rate measures how fast a country's economy is growing / shrinking each year. ::: {#f01dc19f .cell execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](presentation_files/figure-revealjs/cell-2-output-1.png){width=949 height=564} ::: ::: --- ## Measles Immunisation Rate vs Life Expectancy This graph compares the percentage of the popualtion in a country that has received an immunisation from measles. ::: {#c9ff8ba6 .cell execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](presentation_files/figure-revealjs/cell-3-output-1.png){width=808 height=523} ::: ::: --- ## Inflation Rate Statistics ::: {#57d019dc .cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
measles_immunisation_rate gdp_growth_rate inflation_rate
count 193.000000 202.000000 169.000000
mean 83.854922 4.368901 12.493936
std 15.996083 6.626811 19.682433
min 0.000000 -28.758591 -6.687321
25% 76.000000 2.438593 5.518129
50% 90.000000 4.204431 7.967574
75% 96.000000 6.200000 11.665567
max 99.000000 63.439864 171.205491
``` ::: ::: --- ## Conclusion - Wide Variance in GDP per Capita: Countries show significant disparities in GDP per capita, with the highest value being over $240,000 and the lowest under $300. This reflects a broad economic divide between nations. - Higher Measles Immunization Correlates with Longer Life Expectancy: The data indicates that countries with higher measles immunization rates tend to have higher average life expectancy, underscoring the health benefits of vaccination programs.
